intro: Whitlavia gloxinioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, velvety flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, often with a contrasting central spot. Its leaves are thick, fleshy, and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to retain moisture. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
